question: Which South American nation has recently joined International Solar Alliance (ISA)?
explanation: On March 28, President Ram Nath Kovind became the first-ever Indian President to visit Bolivia. Here, President Evo Morales Ayma conferred the highest State Honour of Bolivia - Condor de los Andes en el Grado de Gran Collar - on President Kovind. Both the countries have agreed to facilitate Bolivian supplies of lithium Carbonate to India and foster joint ventures for Lithium battery / cell production plants in India.  This move will make Bolivia, which is known to have one-fourth of the world\'s lithium reserves, one of the major provider of metal for India\'s e-mobility and e-storage needs.  To mark the 150th Birth Anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, India offered two busts of Gandhiji to Bolivia. The Bolivian side accepted the offer and is likely to place the busts in its capital La Paz and its largest city Santa Cruz. This South American nation has also joined the International Solar Alliance (ISA) by signing the framework agreement on ISA. In a total, India and Bolivia have signed 8 MoUs in various fields of mining, space, traditional medicine during President\'s Kovid three day visit to the country.
